availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: W. H. Vaught (Owen County, Kentucky, soldier.)

body.p: Owen County, Kentucky, soldier. Kentucky native. Married to Rebecca A. Sandford in Owen County, Kentucky on June 20, 1864. Mustered in as sergeant in the 9th Regiment Kentucky Cavalry (U.S.A.) August 22, 1862. Reported as deserted March 2, 1863. Returned to duty as sergeant June 5, 1863. Mustered out at Eminence, Kentucky on August 21, 1863.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Owen County, District 1, p. 261B.
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Owen County Marriages, Film #000272776, p. 17 (on microfilm), (accessed via Ancestry.com).
Compiled Service Records of Volunteer Union Soldiers who Served in Organizations From State of Kentucky, NARA RG 94, Microfilm Series M397, Roll 0099.
